PROJECT REQUIREMENTS DOCUMENT

Project: AI-Powered CV Evaluation Platform
Version: 1.0
Date: 2024

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
Build an intelligent CV evaluation system that automatically assesses candidate 
qualifications against job requirements using AI/ML techniques. The platform should 
provide objective scoring and detailed feedback to streamline the hiring process.

TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS

1. Backend Development
   - Build RESTful API using Go with Gin/Echo framework
   - Implement microservices architecture with proper separation of concerns
   - Design database schema for PostgreSQL with proper indexing
   - Implement message queue integration (Redis/Kafka) for async processing
   - Add comprehensive logging and observability (OpenTelemetry)

2. AI/ML Integration
   - Integrate with LLM APIs (OpenAI/Anthropic) for text analysis
   - Implement vector embeddings for semantic similarity matching
   - Build scoring algorithms based on configurable rubrics
   - Handle rate limiting and fallback strategies

3. Frontend Development
   - Create modern SPA using Vue.js/React with TypeScript
   - Implement responsive design for mobile/desktop
   - Build intuitive file upload with drag-and-drop
   - Display results with interactive visualizations

4. DevOps & Infrastructure
   - Containerize with Docker and orchestrate with Kubernetes
   - Set up CI/CD pipeline with GitHub Actions
   - Implement monitoring with Prometheus/Grafana
   - Configure distributed tracing with Jaeger

REQUIRED SKILLS
- Strong Go programming experience (3+ years)
- Experience with microservices and distributed systems
- Familiarity with AI/ML concepts and LLM integration
- Frontend development with modern JavaScript frameworks
- Cloud infrastructure (AWS/GCP) and Kubernetes experience

EVALUATION CRITERIA
1. Technical Depth (40%) - Expertise in required technologies
2. Problem Solving (25%) - Approach to complex challenges
3. Communication (20%) - Clarity in documentation and code
4. Experience (15%) - Relevant project history

DELIVERABLES
- Working prototype with core features
- API documentation (OpenAPI spec)
- Unit and integration tests (>80% coverage)
- Deployment scripts and documentation
